results.title: Dressed to kill
results.creator_credit: Roy William Neill and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Adapted from a story by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle and featuring the inimitable Sherlock Holmes (Basil Rathbone) and his sidekick, Dr Watson (Nigel Bruce). In this tale of mystery and suspense, Holmes has to find the whereabouts of three wooden music boxes containing Bank of England engraving plates in order to prevent certain crims out there from basically obtaining a licence to print money. Cast includes Patricia Morison, Edmond Breon, Frederick Worlock, Carl Harbord, Patricia Cameron.

results.title: Cleopatra
results.creator_credit: Cecil B. DeMille, Adolph Zukor and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Cleopatra is illustrative of the conception of historical epic as charade in which the stars are not only cast as famous historical figures but historical figures are cast as stars (Cleopatra as Colbert). What is absent here is De Mille’s characteristic combination of spectacle and morality play. Instead, the spectacle of a sexual extravaganza, (epitomised by the seduction of Mark Antony on the Royal Barge), verges on self parody. This is held in check only by De Mille’s commitment to conventions of realist stage melodrama, (from his formative years in the theatre), allied with a strong pictorial sensibility. Stars Claudette Colbert, Henry Wilcoxon, Warren William. From an adaptation of historical marterial by Bartlett Cormack.

constellations_other.name: Dress to impress
constellations_other.description: In The Great, Peter and Catherine’s costumes during their Dacha visit are designed to demonstrate their unity, as they negotiate with the Swedish royals. Clothes have long been a way to communicate power, particularly in politics.

results.title: Mighty Joe Young
results.creator_credit: Ernest B Schoedsack, Merian C. Cooper, John Ford, RKO Radio Pictures, Arko Productions and Argosy Pictures
results.brief_description: Following in the footsteps of King Kong, this is a fantasy story about another giant ape by the name of Joe Young, his devoted owner Jill Young (Terry Moore) and the exploitation Joe Young suffers when he is taken from his native country of Africa back to America and the bright lights of Hollywood. Cast also includes Ben Johnson and Robert Armstrong.

constellations_other.name: Sublime light and special effects
constellations_other.description: Explore 19th-century artist John Martin’s surprising influence on science fiction and fantasy films of the 20th century, from Jason and the Argonauts to the Lord of the Rings and the Evil Dead franchises.

results.title: Crimson tide
results.creator_credit: Tony Scott, Jerry Bruckheimer, Don Simpson and Hollywood Pictures
results.brief_description: Two military men from different eras collide when their submarine is engaged in possible nuclear warfare. Gene Hackman plays an old-school captain, fearsome to his staff and a stickler for rules; Denzel Washington plays Lt. Commander Ron Hunter, a Harvard graduate who believes preventing conflict is also the role of the armed forces. As these two face off over the possibility of war, tensions, egos and threats soar. Cast also includes James Gandolfini and Matt Craven.

results.title: The 13th Warrior = The Thirteenth Warrior
results.creator_credit: John McTiernan, Ned Dowd, Michael Crichton and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: Set in 922 AD, an Arab courtier accompanies a party of Vikings to the barbaric North where he is reluctantly enlisted to help them battle the flesh eating Wendol. Cast includes: Antonios Banderas, Omar Sharif.

results.title: Roman scandals
results.creator_credit: Busby Berkeley, Frank Tuttle and Samuel Goldwyn
results.brief_description: An Oklahoma farm boy dreams his way back to the glory of ancient Rome and becomes a spokesman for the oppressed Roman people, suffering under the tyrannical rule of the cruel and sneering Emperor Valerius. A musical comedy of dance and song adapted by William Anthony McGuire from the original story by George S. Kaufman and Robert E. Sherwood with songs by Harry Warren and Al Dublin and production numbers directed by Busby Berkeley. Starring Eddie Cantor and Ruth Etting with Gloria Stuart, Phillips Holmes, Edward Arnold, Alan Mowbray and The Goldwyn Girls and an appearance by Lucille Ball in her film debut as a slave girl.

results.title: Up in arms
results.creator_credit: Elliott Nugent, Samuel Goldwyn and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: Wartime musical comedy about a hypochondriac elevator operator who, after being drafted into the Army, becomes a surprise hero. Infatuated with nurse Mary, Danny Weems (Danny Kaye) tries to set up his friend Joe with her friend and fellow nurse Virginia, (Dinah Shore) but Virginia is crazy about Danny and Joe and Mary fall for each other. After all four enter the Army, Danny, Joe, and Virginia discover they are being transported to the South Pacific aboard the same ship. Danny accidentally causes Mary to be smuggled aboard their ship, and spends much of the film trying to keep her hidden from the colonel. When the troops finally land, Danny is thrown in the brig, where Japanese soldiers first kidnap him and then are tricked into capture by Danny. He returns to Virginia and acclaim as a hero. Cast also includes Dana Andrews, Constance Dowling. the Goldwyn Girls.

results.title: Waltz of the toreadors
results.creator_credit: John Guillermin, Peter de Sarigny, Independent Artists (GB) and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: Peter Sellers plays six different characters in this raunchy World War 2 comedy set in a Parisian brothel. When the Germans march into Paris, the redoubtable Madame Grenier and her girls bid a sad farewell to her clients, and prepares to welcome the occupying Germans. It is not long before Madame and her girls are working for the resistance which earns them, at war’s end, the gratitude of a very amorous French President who presents Madame Grenier with a plague for the wall of her ‘distinguished house’. Screenplay by Wolf Mankowitz from the play by Jean Anouilh. Cast also includes Dany robin, John Fraser, Cyril Cusack, Margaret Leighton, John le Mesurier, Prunella Scales.

results.title: The Sunshine boys
results.creator_credit: Herbert Ross, Ray Stark and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Adapted from the play by Neil Simon, this film version stars two great actors, Walter Matthau and George Burns, as the two cantankerous old-time vaudevillians who have been persuaded to reunite one more time for a television special, despite the fact that they hate each other. Also stars Richard Benjamin.

Also stars Richard Benjamin.

results.title: The Immortal battalion = The Way ahead
results.creator_credit: Carol Reed, John Sutro, Norman Walker, Two Cities Films and G C F
results.brief_description: Beginning as a British Army training film called “The New lot”, this film was then expanded into a feature length film written by Eric Ambler and Peter Ustinov, entitled “The Way ahead” for its British audience and re-edited into a slightly shorter film entitled “The Immortal battalion” for an American audience. Its basic concept is as a recruiting and training film for the British Army mixing training and combat footage with filmed sequences. The storyline is about a bunch of raw recruits from a variety of backgrounds who are finally welded into a unified and disciplined regimental unit ready for battle. Stars David Niven, Stanley Holloway, Peter Ustinov, Trevor Howard.
